name: John Doe
bio: John Doe is an experienced chef with over 10 years of culinary experience. He specializes in Italian and French cuisine.

recipesList.name: Chicken Parmesan
recipesList.description: Juicy, tender roast chicken with crispy skin.
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. 
2. Place breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese in a shallow dish. 
3. Place flour in a separate shallow dish. 
4. Place beaten eggs in another shallow dish. 
5. Coat chicken breasts in flour, shaking off excess. 
6. Dip in egg, then coat in breadcrumb mixture. 
7. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 
8. Add chicken to skillet and cook until browned on both sides. 
9. Transfer chicken to a baking dish. 
10. Pour marinara sauce over chicken. 
11. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese. 
12. Bake for 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipesList.name: Pesto Pasta
recipesList.description: A rustic vegetable stew with a rich tomato sauce.
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 
2. In a food processor, pulse basil leaves and garlic until finely chopped. 
3. Add Parmesan cheese and pulse to combine. 
4. With the food processor running, slowly pour in olive oil until the mixture forms a smooth sauce. 
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
6. Toss pasta with pesto sauce.

recipesList.name: Grilled Salmon
recipesList.description: A decadent dessert with a light, airy texture.
recipesList.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat grill for medium heat. 
2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. 
3. Brush salmon with the olive oil mixture. 
4. Place salmon on the grill, skin side down. 
5. Grill for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
